website_summaries.verdict: The Microsoft Wedge Mobile Keyboard offers one of the best-designed wireless Bluetooth keyboard and tablet-stand combinations on the market, especially when you pair it with a Windows 8 device.
pros: Sturdy construction and thoughtful design make the Microsoft Wedge Mobile Keyboard stand out
cons: It's a tad pricey at $79, and (no surprise) it lacks universal hot keys that work in non-Microsoft operating systems

customer_reviews.title: but would have a small foot print for a cary bag and would work great for that
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use with a Surface pro 3 , I have the cover keyboard and use that in the field. At home i use a docking station and needed a different option. This fit bill perfectly. I have large hands and this is a small keyboard and i have no issues with it. I am used to working on an Apple keyboard and this is similar in size, just a shade smaller. (see picture) It synced up the Surface Pro with no issue and stays synced. I do not use for travel, but would have a small foot print for a cary bag and would work great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Pedigo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic keyboard. Nicely done, Microsoft.
customer_reviews.text: ONE YEAR LATER I'm updating this review and taking the keyboard from five stars down to two. The keyboard has been lightly and infrequently used. I'm experiencing issues with squeaking keys and a spacebar that is nonresponsive if tapped anywhere but dead center. Also, and as others have reported, the batteries leaked inside the keyboard. Just know that durability may be questionable here. ----- As a fan on minimalism, I really appreciate this keyboard. It's beautifully designed, and well built. Key travel is just perfect for me. It pairs very quickly across multiple devices. I'm generally using this with my Note 8 and Samsung Dex.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great tactile feel for portable keyboard, but fatally flawed
customer_reviews.text: The tactile feel is great for a portable keyboard, better than any other portable I have tried. However the cover for it is super heavy. What sense does that make? I used it without the cover and soon one of the keys broke off, making the keyboard hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Most keyboards are just keyboards. Small or large, lots of feature keys and so on. Thus is almost a piece of art it is so tightly designed. It's a joy to write with. Writing, not coding, not spread-sheeting, just writing. Minimal, solid, quiet, batteries don't seem to ever ever die. Has the right amount of non skid rubber to hold it against the Surface pro when I get up to move around, and it holds the Surface vertically so well and the adjustability for angle is fantastic. Vertical or horizontal. I almost never use the Surface's built in stand. I have bought extras so I can use this keyboard for years and years.
customer_reviews.author: John d

customer_reviews.title: too heavy and small
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many Microsoft keyboards over the years and have always loved the ergo dynamics. This one not so much, so it is going back. Pros: sturdy design Cons: 1. This one is a bit heavy for its intended purpose of being a keyboard you can carry around and with the legendary feel of Microsoft keyboards. 2. The Bluetooth connection to my surface book wasn't very reliable either. 3. It arrived with a sulfated battery, which tells me it's been sitting in its box for many years. 4. Given its weight, it should have been at least foldable (or a bit bigger -- the keyboard is just too small to type on comfortably for me).
customer_reviews.author: Ramin A.

customer_reviews.title: Keyboarding
customer_reviews.text: Probably hands down the best mobile keyboard I've used. Perfect for Surface Pro, iPads, Android tablets, even used it with the PS4. Operation (on/off, pairing) is a snap once you've done it. Typing is comfortable, the tactile feedback from the keyboard is good. I'm not going to be writing essays or doing data entry with it, but its quite adequate for emailing, web surfing, on-line activities. The keyboard cover is a nice touch, takes all the bother out of just tossing the keyboard in a backpack. The cover doubling as a tablet easel is a bonus. Battery life appears good.
customer_reviews.author: UnregisteredTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: ... you for only a couple months and it's the worst - it frequently stops working and I have tried ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Microsoft Keyboard I bought from you for only a couple months and it's the worst - it frequently stops working and I have tried trouble shooting to no avail. I have to remove bluetooth connection and then reconnect to get it working again and that takes a very long time and once it's back up and running there's no way to know how long it will last. This happens nearly every hour. I'm trying to get work done!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Very poor connectivity.  Constant restarts to re-establish connection.
customer_reviews.text: I switched from a Logitech keyboard to this one. I use the Microsoft Surface Book... so I figured this would work very well (given that it's also Microsoft) and it wouldn't require a dongle! I've been extremely disappointed by the consistent drops in connectivity, requiring me to restart the keyboard (and then connectivity works just fine). It has been a rather terrible experience given the Logitechs performance.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Have the older version still, haven't been using it too much but I can't stress how incredibly useful the cover it comes with is. It can hold a surface pro 3 steady, it doesn't slip off the table. The keys feel good, it is a little crammed, but you get used to it fairly quickly. The main issue is hitting the directional keys. Otherwise the rest is fairly standard. This is my favorite mobile keyboard in the last 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Terrific bluetooth keyboard for iPad mini
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard with an iPad mini. It works flawlessly. Taking the case off powers it on; the case is a great stand for the iPad. I have been using it for a few months and have not had to change the batteries yet. There are no issues in synching with the iPad; when I take the case off of the keyboard, any keystrokes are immediately recognized by the tablet. There have been no lag issues. As a writer, I've found this to be incredibly useful. I would buy this keyboard again tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Lv2Read

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is superbly built, feels very durable and very well designed -- except for one part: the space bar. It has significant dead zones on each end, about a finger's width. Although it looks like the whole space bar is pushed down, I guess it's just barely missing the contact. I desperately want to love this keyboard, but a bad space bar is crippling. Wondering if I just got a slightly faulty unit as I don't see many other complaints about it. *Update:* I was able to correct the space bar problem by cutting a little strip of credit card to insert under the middle, where the rubber spring is. Works great now!
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Solid mobile keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard for the size. Can easily use in a lap unlike the new folding keyboard. Keys are a bit close but easily adaptable. The short cut keys are a great feature even in Windows 10. Connects easily with my 950 XL and never has connection issues. Further, the battery last for quite a long time. The lid does weigh far more than it should but performs its purpose quite well. However, it is a magnet for fuzz and cat hair. A little rinse with warm water is all that is needed to make it look like new again. My only other wish is it having a rechargeable battery built in. Definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Albe

customer_reviews.title: I like my new Microsoft Wedge Mobile Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with my MICROSOFT SURFACE PRO 3. I already had the keyboard acts as a cover. I use Photoshop a lot and need to use the shortcut keys. The keyboard that is made foe the Surface only works when attached to the Surface and is in the forward position, When folded backwards, it does not work. I like my new Microsoft Wedge Mobile Keyboard, as it can be used away from the surface, at my side while working on Photoshop with computer on my lap. Wish I had purchased the Wedge instead of the keyboard made as a cover for the Surface.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Graetz

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why it happens consistently but it is very annoying.
customer_reviews.text: The Bluetooth functionality works without a hitch. The battery case is used to raise the back of the keyboard up for ease of use. it does not, however, reach to the ends of the keyboard, so there are times when reaching the upper keys that the keyboard tips to the side. Not a deal breaker, but unpleasant. My primary issue, and it could just be me, is that for some reason I constantly engage Capslock when using the "a" key. I have tried to train myself without effect. Not sure why it happens consistently but it is very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard! Works perfectly with my Samsung Galaxy Note Pro 12.2" Android tablet. Very high build quality. Love how the protective cover turns off the keyboard automatically when attached and also doubles as a very good stand for my large tablet. I have a love/hate relationship with the battery compartment underneath the keyboard. It's great because it props the keyboard up to a very comfortable typing angle. It's not so great because it adds significant bulk. That said, I'd still highly recommend this keyboard! If you need a mouse, check out the Wedge Touch Mouse too, also an excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: 911jason

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I owned this for about 3 years and here’re my thoughts: * The keystrokes doesn’t feel good. That’s probably because the keyboard is too small for my hand. But then my hand is pretty small so who was this keyboard designed for? Little girls? Also it feels really shallow when typing. The keys would only go about half of what average laptop keys do. So when I hit a key, it doesn’t really feel like a proper keystroke, more like a half-assed one. * The keyboard cover is a dust magnet. No clue how I am supposed to clean it. I even tried cleaning it with water but with no success.
customer_reviews.author: Jonghwa B.

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Almost everything about this keyboard is spot-on relative to its intended use--portability. It is well designed and constructed with nice materials, giving it a premium look and feel. Typing on it feels nice, although a bit cramped (but that is to be expected from a portable keyboard). The keys travel just the right amount to make it keel responsive, and I haven't noticed any cursor lag when typing. My only gripe is the battery housing that protrudes from the underside of the keyboard. It adds some bulk to the unit. Perhaps the next iteration of this keyboard will eliminate this protrusion outright, and have an integrated rechargeable battery. Then it will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mad

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. Build quality is durable. Small and compact like what I was looking for. My PC is dual boot with Linux. The only thing wrong with this Bluetooth keyboard is that when I turn the PC in I don't get to pick what OS I want to pick. It stays asleep till the grub menu times out and boots into windows. I have to do a restart to keep it awake to choose Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny S

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Very portable. It's a good small size no larger than the keyboard of a surface pro 4. I like the cover it comes with it, provides protection and automatically shuts off the keyboard. The product arrived on time but its box seemed old, like it's been sitting on shelves for decades (product it's from 2012) but it was all new and it worked perfectly. So if what you want is a small portable bluetooth keyboard , give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: and it feels really nice if you like the feeling of a low-profile "laptop" ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently typing this review with this keyboard, and it feels really nice if you like the feeling of a low-profile "laptop" style keyboard. It has all the keys I need for programming and web development, and it lets me sit on my couch while using my TV as a big screen for working. The connectivity is great and it wasn't hard to set up at all: Windows 10 > Bluetooth icon in taskbar > Connect Microsoft Wedge Keyboard > Type six digits on keyboard and press Enter.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff R.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is perfect. The layout is the same as a regular keyboard. Yes, the keyboard is small, but it is a mobile keyboard. What do you expect? I'm 6'3 and 280 lbs with big hands and this keyboard works fine for me. I am using it with a Surface 3 instead of the keyboard that comes with the tablet when I am not on the go. Easy to sync to your computer or tablet via Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher H.

customer_reviews.title: Could be a lot better.
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it is a good choice for my Surface Pro - unfortunately, the Bluetooth connection is spotty. Frequently the computer won't recognize it and I have to remove it from the 'devices' and set it up again as a new device. This wastes time and is a pain. I end up not using it simply because it is quicker to attach a regular USB keyboard. not sure whether the issue is something about Bluetooth or an issue with the keyboard itself (other Bluetooth devices - some from Microsoft - have no issues). TL:DR - When it works, it's a good keyboard, it just doesn't work reliably.
customer_reviews.author: DRich57

customer_reviews.title: wish it had bigger edges
customer_reviews.text: it took awhile to get the keyboard to pair with my dell venue 8 pro...no instructions. but, I finally figured out that I had to hold down the Bluetooth key for at least 10 seconds. then the venue saw it and it paired right up. however, it has such a small form factor, that the keys go almost all the way to the edges. good for typing more easily, bad for picking it up without inadvertently typing something. would have been nice to have a teeny little users' guide that showed how to turn it on...the web site shows one thing and a youtube blog showed another. (the cover does it too, but...)
customer_reviews.author: P. gordon

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Wedge keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a few other keyboards, and returned them. Then I found the wedge. I find it perfect for my use. The keyboard attached itself to the tablet effortlessly via Bluetooth. The cover has a dual purpose in that it not only protects the keyboard, but also turns the keyboard on when you remove the cover and off when you cover the keyboard with it. The layout is just like my desktop keyboard. It even has some quick keys for W 8.1. I rate it an excellent product, well made and at a good price. Shipping was on time And packaged well. I know I am going to enjou continued use of this keyboard with the tablet. BobK
customer_reviews.author: bobkflyer,  in a word-----excellent.  five stars.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bluetooth keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love my Wedge. It might be tricky to get it to sync, but once you do, it's so easy to use. It turns on and works automatically if you take the case off after your computer is already on. It's very small, but comfortable. Very easy to type on, and has all the functionality I wanted (including Media Player controls). The edges are super shiny/reflective, so I ended up painting the sides (and top of the sides) with black nail polish, because the glare was really getting to me. That would be my only complaint, if I minded having to do that, which I didn't. I would highly recommend this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: veggieveggievegveg

customer_reviews.title: Think twice
customer_reviews.text: You would think that Microsoft would produce a keyboard that would work; nope. Didn't work. The keyboard is well designed and very portable with a nice cover that doubles as a stand for other devices. Nice key layout also. It's small and light. BUT, IT DOES NOT MAINTAIN PAIRING AND CONNECTING. I have to use a wired or non-Bluetooth wireless board to get it to work and then it won't keep working. What were they thinking ?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I hoped it would be an awesome keyboard and I was worried that it might be too small; I have really big hands. When I received it, it looked even better than I expected. My coworkers (Apple users) were all impressed that Microsoft made such a sweet looking keyboard. As far as usage goes, I love the response of the keys and the size is great. It is small (which I wanted - something very portable) but they keys themselves are pretty much normal sized, just the space between keys has been removed. I'm a pretty good typist so I adapted to this keyboard quickly and love it and can churn out work on it without any loss in speed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling and desktop
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed about this product in that it is small enough to bring when traveling and the keypads are big enough for daily desktop use. It comes with a cover that bends for tablet use (not that you really need a physical keyboard for your tablets). The Bluetooth works with both Macs, PCs, desktops, laptops, Android & iOS tablets. The only issue is that when used with a desktop the DEL button does not work when you want to access your BIOS settings. The Microsoft Bluetooth Keyboard 6000 handles it better. But I like the design and slimness of this product that's I I ended purchasing it for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Eric G

customer_reviews.title: Look at other Bluetooth keyboards, but buy this one
customer_reviews.text: First glance, it looks too small. But, for a compact keyboard it works fine for this touch typist. Batteries last forever. No trouble pairing like a lot of other Bluetooth keyboards. Cover shuts off the keyboard w/o needing to power down. Cover doubles as stand. Great companion to Microsoft Wedge Mouse. Well made and not a stitch of cheap plastic. If you're looking at the Logitech K480 or some of the other Bluetooth keyboards out there, this is a far better buy and doesn't remind you how little you spent.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burdick

customer_reviews.title: Great, but extremely small keys for large hands.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a last minute thing as I was leaving for travel and a key on my laptop's keyboard wasn't working, so I needed a small portable keyboard. This did well and is pretty light and fit easily in my laptop bag without a hitch. The problem is..it's too small and I have sausage fingers. I needed to be extra careful typing with it. I thought i'd get used to typing on it after 3 days. I didn't.
customer_reviews.author: ayb

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Doesn't Fit in My Tablet Case
customer_reviews.text: It works great - pairing was easy, and my tablet finds the keyboard again after being turned off without a problem. The only issue I have is that there's a "wedge" at the bottom of the keyboard - I imagine this is for comfort of typing. Wish this was removable, though, because the keyboard is not flat, and thus, will not fit at all into my case. I have to carry the keyboard separately. Oh well... Just keep that in mind, if you're looking for a FLAT keyboard to put inside inside your case, don't get this. If you don't care about that, this keyboard is great!
customer_reviews.author: alohanoa

customer_reviews.title: Nice mini keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great little bluetooth keyboard. Had no problem connecting it to my device, the key strokes are nice and crisp. This is a miniature keyboard so can be difficult to type on if you have large hands. It is ergonomically designed using the battery compartment to recreate a natural incline. There is a slight delay when waking up my device and when the keyboard actually reconnects, maybe 10 seconds so not a big deal. The quality of the build is quite a bit better than what I expected for the price. Overall, it does what I bought it for and I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky R

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for Android tablets
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard works great with my Galaxy Note Pro 12.2 tablet. Along with a mouse and the right software, I have an excellent alternative to a laptop. Key size and response are great for a compact keyboard, and I love the fact that the cover transforms into a stand for the tablet. Most of the function keys actually work under Android, even though this is technically a Windows keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Packrat

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: It's a OK kind of keyboard. Nice build and quality. I have an average size fingers but it seemd that keys get stuck or mistakenly press. Now don't get me wrong, I am a fast typer and I do type three proper way and without looking but even with several days of use, I'd still make more frequent mistakes as compared to standard keyboard. I'd still keep it though for it its great for travelling and it's a great partner to my surface comp.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey only

customer_reviews.title: Great little wireless keyboard used with media center
customer_reviews.text: Great little wireless keyboard used with media center. Nice soft key travel, silent. Wish the back section where the batteries went were rubber to help hold it in place on a table or desk. The thin single rubber strip at the front does not really grip well.
customer_reviews.author: Cms10

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Bluetooth keyboard I have tried with my Thinkpad Tablet 2 and apparently the third time is the charm. This one works very well, Once paired it automatically pairs immediately when I turn on the Thinkpad Tablet 2. The keyboard cover doubles as a stand for the tablet and is very convenient and sturdy. It also fits snugly onto the keyboard to protect it from dust and dirt. All in all, Microsoft hit this one out of the park. Inexpensive, nicely engineered, designed for Windows tablets, convenient, extremely portable, responsive, and I would buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really nice quality. I bought the Business one the second time. It's identical to the 'retail' version except for the packaging. it has the same product and cover and batteries. This is a really nice keyboard. No latency that you can get from blue tooth on cheaper keyboards. The keys work very well. Set up is also a snap and it doesn't lose connection on shut down and start ups. I bought the second one for my daughter after my wife was so happy with hers.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Michael

customer_reviews.title: Solidly constructed blue tooth keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely designed. The use of metal backing to support the keyboard makes it feel solid. Used this unit for over 5 months and each time it linked to my tablet without issue. I also liked the feel of the keys. It is more like a tack tile than a cheap 101 keyboard. What is more important is the right shift key is a full size key. Unlike most small keyboards, I did not have the mistake of hitting the up arrow key since the right shift key is a full size.
customer_reviews.author: Jack in the Box

customer_reviews.title: Finally a great keyboard for the Samsung 7 Slate
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is slightly shorter than the Slate. The keys are a tiny bit compact, but my fingers adjust immediately. It is not like some of the micro keyboards I have tried. What I like best about it is that it feels rugged and strong. The black cover is very heavy, but it makes the keyboard backpack worthy. This is a keyboard that can truly survive in a student's backpack. I don't use the cover as a stand because I purchased the standard case for my Slate that acts as a stand. I recommend this keyboard because it connects every time -- instantly, it is extremely rugged and goes for weeks on a single charge.
customer_reviews.author: CEEmom

customer_reviews.title: I love the automatic on-off feature
customer_reviews.text: Simple, compact and durable as heck. I love the automatic on-off feature. This thing comes with a rubberized metallic cover that doubles as a stand for your tablet. Beautifully designed, and they even included a DEL key, unlike many android keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Mav

customer_reviews.title: really beautiful and very well engineered product
customer_reviews.text: really beautiful and very well engineered product. Even the cover for the device is amazing. You don't have to worry about turning it on/off or waking up your tablet when it has been put in a bag because of the cover, which is somehow a hing that functions also as a tablet stand. As for the keyboard, it is so easy to type on, compact, and stiff that I cannot think of any way it could be better. Also, with a windows pc the volume, play/pause, printscreen, etc buttons work perfect. Tilt of the device is very good, the back is around 3/4 inch higher.
customer_reviews.author: ashay

customer_reviews.title: Great for Table-Use, Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have had this keyboard for about 6 months now and I really like it! I use this with my ASUS vivotab via bluetooth connection, and I had no problems with the keyboard. Sometimes if you don't use it for a while, it falls asleep. So just tilt it and somehow knows you want to get busy with it. Great object for tables. It would be challenging to prop up a tablet on your lap though (since the tablet stand has a small base). Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: There are a whole bunch of things I like about this keyboard, first, many similar board are actually just junk. Read the reviews, most break, eat to much power or are unreliable. Although the keyboard is a bit heavy as far as portables go, its sturdy, well built, good on battery life and the cover that comes with it does actually make a great for my tablet(s). I actually have two of these, one from work and one I bought for myself... now my wife uses it... so it looks like I will be getting another one. :)
customer_reviews.author: Eric G. Johnfelt

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm familiar with Microsoft accessories... game pads, mice, etc. The price may be a bit higher, but you know you're getting a well designed and tested piece of gear. This keyboard didn't disappoint. Light and compact enough to slip into my backpack next to my Dell Venue 8 Pro, and just enough weight to stay where I put it so I can use it. Those complaining this keyboard is too heavy are likely chasing their $10 Chinese BT keyboard as it slides around the table or off of their lap as they type. The combination cover and tablet stand is a simple but elegant touch.
customer_reviews.author: Harry K.

customer_reviews.title: Where was this before?!?!?!
customer_reviews.text: Great Bluetooth keyboard!! I purchased this for my Surface RT. Sometimes I hookup my Surface to a TV for viewing movies, shows, etc and I want a wireless keyboard to control from the couch or bed. This keyboard fit the bill perfectly. I am able to lay my tablet on the desk/table and rest it on the included keyboard cover (that doubles as a tablet stand) and lay back on the couch and surf the web or watch movies with ease. This Bluetooth keyboard paired with the Microsoft Edge Mouse is a win-win for anyone with a tablet!! I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: SmurfsRiot

customer_reviews.title: Pretty dang good for a Microsoft hardware product....
customer_reviews.text: I've never had much luck or satisfaction with any of Microsoft's hardware products in the past. This keyboard and to a somewhat lesser extent the Wedge Mouse have been a pleasant surprise for me. Works just fine with my Win 8 Vaio notebook... absolutely no complaints (so far.... 5 days and running....). I will note that ergonomics is clearly not high in the designer's priority for either product. To be satisfied with the gizmos, compactness and style have to be overriding considerations..... that or really small hands!
customer_reviews.author: AOei

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetically pleasing device, and works as expected. Damaged box.
customer_reviews.text: Aesthetically pleasing device, and works as expected. The cover is sturdy enough to support even a tablet on the heavy side. Keys have good travel, although layout is slightly cramped. Bluetooth pairing is a breeze too. Sadly, I don't need the device. This was an accidental one-click shopping purchase. Device is nice enough for me to keep. Will not be returning. Also, packaging was a bit damaged upon arrival. Box was torn at the crease, but did not affect item inside. Taking away one star because of this.
customer_reviews.author: meeegs

customer_reviews.title: Need a keyboard buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: I received a new Surface for Christmas and was looking for a keyboard. Microsoft makes specific keyboards that attach to the Surface but I was looking for a keyboard that wouldn't limit me. By doing it this way it allows me to place the Surface on a table and the keyboard in my lap. It connected very easily. The keyboard cover holds the surface really well. if you're looking for a keyboard I would highly recommend this one. In addition I bought a neoprene cover/bag and the keyboard and the Surface fit into it very well.
customer_reviews.author: Gary G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a tablet, stand is great.
customer_reviews.text: The bluetooth keyboard keeps getting disconnected from my tablet PC. Every so often I have to re-pair the device. I thought it was an issue with my Tablet at first, but I tried with other devices and the same problem occurred.Stand is great and the keyboard is perfect for a windows tablet, other than the bluetooth problem, it is great.
customer_reviews.author: qualiFIED

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is second only to the Logitech Bluetooth keyboard in excellence, and only because it is not illuminated. It has a wonderful touch, and it is ergonomically designed to perfection. Its cover does serve as a stand and and excellent one at that. It is light and small, and it fits inside the case of my tablet computer so precisely that you'd think it was a custom accessory for it. It has replaceable rechargeable batteries, to boot. You will never regret buying this little keyboard. if it were illuminated, it would take first place next to its Logitech competitor.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Ross Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard, I use it wireless with my Microsoft Surface when I've got the surface on a hands free holder. I like that it has all of the same Microsoft keys I'm used to from my Surface Type keyboard, I originally had a third party blue tooth keyboard that worked fine but didn't have the Microsoft keys. I haven't tried using the cover as a stand, I just use it to cover my keyboard when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenclaw98

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is better than I expected. It's very small, very compact, yet the keys are full size, and have action keys along the top. The frame is very minimal, so makes it very small. The Bluetooth was pretty simple to connect, I used it on my PC with built in Bluetooth and all it needed was putting the PC into search mode, then type in a 6 digit code from the screen onto the keyboard and press enter and it connected.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E Powell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Windows tablet
customer_reviews.text: I've used this keyboard for several years now alongside a Windows tablet. It's not too heavy to carry around with your tablet. Pairs very easily and the auto on/off functionality is great. The battery life on this device is phenomenal; I've barely ever needed to recharge the Sanyo eneloop AAA batteries I was using for this keyboard. The cover works really well as a stand for the tablet, especially with such a slip-resistant cover. After a few years of near-daily use, the rubber cover around the metal joint in the middle has begun to tear (the joint itself is in great condition).
customer_reviews.author: Ian Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want mobile keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Thinner and more compact than i expected. The wedge doesn't really stick out as i thought it would. Looks and feels great. Keys are nice and tac tile. Great to carry around in a bag. I use it mainly for my tablet. Connects fast and easily. I got used to typing on it rather quickly considering how close the keys are to each other. Would not recommend using it as a primary keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Rommel

customer_reviews.title: Well designed keyboard.. just wish it was a little wider.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard because it comes with a flex cover that can be used to prop up your laptop or tablet. The cover also keeps the keyboard from getting ruined inside a bag. Since it's bluetooth too it keeps it from constantly being in a woken status so it doesn't drain the battery. 4 stars because sometimes it feels a little cramped.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: really well disgined
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard, super small, and amazing design overall. The cover can act as a stand for tablets and when put back on the keyboard turns it off to save battery, really like that feature. Also its tiny but still very easy to use which makes it the perfect travel keyboard, I wanna start using it for all my Bluetooth devices now, even my phone! The only complaint I have is when I received it the battery compartment kinda got jammed and had to use a pen to click it so the battery will lock, but easily fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Ash Huston

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for tablets
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with my Galaxy Note Pro and I really like it. I love the fact that it turns itself on and off just by removing or replacing the cover and it automatically connects to my Note PRO. I also like the fact that the cover can be used as a tablet holder. It takes a little time to get used to the smaller keyboard, but the keys are great to use. It also has a built in stand so that it is raised a little and not flat. i would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far with (AT&T) Samsung Tab 3, 7.0!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh I am so happy!!! This keyboard works with my Samsung Tab 3, 7.0!!!! I researched for two weeks, but never found a single review for a Samsung Tab 3, 7.0 (7") - and a compatible Bluetooth keyboard. Sure, the titles say that they're compatible, but user reviews are what I like to read. Anyway, that's why I am typing this now. For all of you who have one of these little toys (Samsung Tab 3, 7.0), this Microsoft Wedge works with it! Perfectly so far for me! Oh I am so happy! A great buy! Hope it continues to work.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Morales

customer_reviews.title: Ok keyboard, horrible stand/cover
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard itself is ok. It types nicely and isn’t crammed. However, the “stand” is pure garbage. You can’t even get it on to cover the keyboard most of the time! And it doesn’t sit nice and flush when it IS on. My package seemed to have been open prior to shipping because there were scratches on it already. Also, it seems someone dropped it even! VERY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: H4GLTE

customer_reviews.title: one word. awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a mobile keyboard for both my ipad and android tablet. It works excellent with both. pairing is easy just turn on blue tooth and tab pair and type password with keyboard itself. done. It seems to have close keys but typing on it is not as hard as it looks. I just love this product and one more thing, keyboard cover which acts as stand works very well. It can hold my heavy old ipad and my small android tablet very well. just love this. well done Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: Sepehr Pakbaz

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Wedge Mobile Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: best Bluetooth mobile keyboard i have ever owned. its small so its perfect to carry it anywhere and put it in anywhere. battery life is really good it last you more than a couple of months i have owned this for about 6 months and i havent changed the batteries yet. it looks really good and sleek and durable. its magnet cover is pretty cool you used that and the keyboard shuts down and also the keyboard has a sleep mode that works good in ten minutes it will go to sleep if nothing has been clicked and it really takes not even a second to turn back on.
customer_reviews.author: Ant

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I had looked at other portable keyboards which were much cheaper, and had to return them because of disappointment. This board paired with my Galaxy S3 immediately, and the keyboard is finger friendly!! It is a little heavy, but that's alright. I can use it when I travel to send emails home etc. It also runs on regular AAA batteries. Most of the other keyboards have a rechargeable battery with a USB plug. However, when you are traveling with just a smart phone, the USB option is not available! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Mcalear

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this keyboard. Design-wise it is perfect for my needs now as I am travelling. I'm using it for my computer and it feels and looks nice. HOWEVER, it is just not very reliable about 50% of the time. During that 50% of the time, when I strike a key ever so gently, the keyboard overprocesses it and goessssssssssssss likeeeeeeeeeee thiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiii. It is super irritating. Along with this, sometimes it just won't process my key strokes at all and the green light will flicker. I would return it if I could, but I am not overseas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little keyboard. Pros: Easy to pair Looks awesome Very compact Keys feel amazing and do not collect finger prints Aluminum construction Cons: Had to get used to typing on something this small. The keys were easy to find, but still I missed every now and then. Still an awesome keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Super handy and well-priced keyboard. It is quite small, but I have large hands and adapted right away. Well built. The cover is very firm; I feel comfortable putting it in my bag and avoid key compression. I do not use the cover as a stand, but it is folding and strong and would probably work fine. Using it with a 2014 Macbook Pro Yosemite and Bootcamp Windows 8.1. Works fine under both OS. Just pair it under OSX first.
customer_reviews.author: Loci

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic premium keyboard at a mid-range price for tablets large and small.
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the best portable bluetooth keyboard I've ever used. The fact that the cover doubles as a tablet stand is a great bonus. There's consumer and business packaging for this keyboard. The packaging may differ but the contents are the same, so buy whatever is cheapest at time of purchase. I paired this to my Asus VivoTab Note 8 tablet and it works great. Excellent battery life, easy to touch type on. Easy, fast pairing. Looks good to boot.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Needed a keyboard for my Tablet
customer_reviews.text: After a long personal debate about needing to lug more stuff with a tablet, I took the plunge for this lil guy... Using this on my old Galaxy 10.1 to do email and write random notes on the go, got tired of the board tapping (which is fine for short quickies). Nice to use a keyboard that setups up quick and props up anywhere. Now I can drink my coffee and type with the other hand.
customer_reviews.author: D G

customer_reviews.title: The portable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Awesome possum :-) Started using this keyboard right out of the box and it's been smooth and responsive. The size us just about right and linking it up with the laptop was easy and quick, no issues as the operating system was also windows. The protective cover feels durable and the over all feel and aesthetics is beautiful :-)
customer_reviews.author: Olivier

customer_reviews.title: Great mobile keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Perfect mobile keyboard when you're looking for something a little sturdier than one built in a case. I chose this one because I didn't want a keyboard getting in the way when I was using my tablet as an e-reader. I just slip this one in my work bag and bring it out in meetings when I need it. It's not too bulky and the case doubles as a stand which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: no complaints
customer_reviews.text: i use this with the wedge mouse for a compact HTPC and they are perfect for my needs. cons: note that it is bluetooth only so it is useless without motherboard. pci, or usb bluetooth adapter. also useless for bios. key size is standard for alphanumerics with less spacing and reduced key size for all other keys (see image(s)). keystroke will wake up keyboard and host adapter but _will not_ wake computer from sleep (win7). pros: everything else, really.
customer_reviews.author: DBS

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is a solid, well-made piece of equipment. The cover doubles as a device stand, and does great at that. I have tried the cover as a stand with 7,8.and 11 inch tablets with great success. The keyboard works with both android and windows (haven't tried it with apple but am sure it will work) and doesn't have any issues with lag or connecting. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Glass

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, let's get the obvious out of the way: this is a keyboard is meant for Windows 8 but it works with anything that has Bluetooth and the appropriate HID profile. Ok on with the pros: Excellent key feedback Convenient keys for win 8 Upscale feel and looks Great quality and build Awesome cover/stand extra, seriously this thing is great Cons: None, only a very minor gripe with lagging connection at very rare times, but it seems to be a bug on windows 8 because my other Bluetooth devices also lag, it could also be my hardware
customer_reviews.author: Jeff James

customer_reviews.title: Great for small tablets
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my Asus Vivotab Note 8, which I take notes with during my lectures. This keyboard is small enough and light enough for me to carry in my backpack along with my tablet and books, and it works very well. Pairing the device doesn't take very long, and it can be used almost instantly each time I remove the cover. I also use this with the Wedge mouse, which is a great product as well. I'm very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: aas1785

customer_reviews.title: Sculpt Comfort Mouse and Wegde Mobile Keyboard works perfectly on Toshiba Encore Tablets
customer_reviews.text: I had issues with Anker® T300 Ultra-Slim Mini Bluetooth 3.0 Wireless Keyboard and AmazonBasics Bluetooth Keyboard before. Combination of the Bluetooth keyboard and Microsoft Bluetooth mouse with WiFi enabled at the same time, causes the problems on our two Encore WT8 tablets. The keyboard starts repeating the keys and the mouse starts to stutter. BT mouse and BT keyboard / Wifi OFF ----> works fine Only BT keyboard / Wifi ON ----> works fine Only BT mouse / Wifi ON ----> works fine Now, combination of the Sculpt Comfort Mouse and the Wegde Mobile Keyboard with WiFi enabled works perfectly. I do not have issues of keyboard repeating the keys and the mouse stuttering any more.
customer_reviews.author: hrshfjsw

customer_reviews.title: Compact but very useful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Wedge Keyboard retail version, if that makes any difference. I was a little hesitant to purchase this keyboard because it seemed so small. But now that I’ve used it for a few weeks I’m really happy I got it. It works great with the Surface Pro and gives me the ability to move around when I’m typing. It fits easily in my mini-laptop bag and the removable cover (which doubles as a stand) is an added bonus. Overall I’m very pleased with the Wedge Keyboard
customer_reviews.author: D. Deavours

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for basic Excel functions on iPad as advertised #MicrosoftMobileFail3.0
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointing - bought it ONLY so I could use Excel more effectively on iPad - complete failure for that - ALT keys don't work and copy/paste doesn't work - Bluetooth setup TERRIBLE on iPad - required hardkey over iPad window to input code, not like normal pop-up on iPad - Microsoft has failed their iPad users AGAIN - other than that, for $36 Amazon price, it is a great basic keyboard with slick design and great stand - torn on keeping it since it failed to live up to my needs and how it was advertised. Logitech still makes best iPad keyboard - easy sync & charge, easy portability, Microsoft doesn't understand the mobile consumer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mobile keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard paired easily to my tablet PC (Windows8) and makes a perfect travel item. At home, I use a full keyboard with number pad. When traveling, the full keyboard is not an option due to its size. This keyboard fits easily into my messenger bag with my tablet (Sony series 7 slate). Since my tablet has only one USB port, it is really nice that this keyboard connects through bluetooth. There is no lag as some Bluetooth keyboard have. I highly recommend this travel keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: DNel

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Poor Quality Battery Compartment
customer_reviews.text: We use this with our Nexus Player to control our home media center, and it works flawlessly. I really wish that it used a rechargeable battery instead of the out-of-place plastic AAA battery compartment, but otherwise, the product is high-quality and well-designed.
customer_reviews.author: Calah DeLaurentis

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for my Logitech K480 keyboard (too bulk and with really hard pressing keys) and I found the Wedge keyboard. I must say it has been a delight. It has an excellent size; although it looks much smaller than the k480, I have not felt it crowded at any time. It has never disconnected once, and it is a natural keyboard for the windows experience. I really recommend it. I love that you can use the cover as a table-stand.
customer_reviews.author: Franko Restovic Carvajal

customer_reviews.title: A force multiplier for your Kindle Fire tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard recently as a companion for my Kindle FIre HDX 8.9 as I hate typing on virtual keyboards. I think it works great. No trouble with the Bluetooth pairing with the KF and infinitely better than the virtual board. Having a real keyboard enhances the utility of the KF tablet. If I want to type some e-mails or write a review like this one it's a much easier task with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Colonel DTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase for my Microsoft surface
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase for my Microsoft surface. The stand gave me the range I wanted in tilt angle for the screen and the keypad always connects and stays connected. Small and lightweight for easy transport with any laptop bag!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Kimpton

customer_reviews.title: super thin, works great with dell venue 8 pro
customer_reviews.text: I tried syncing this with my windows 8 HTPC and my dell venue 8 pro, and they both paired perfectly without incident. However, when I tried to pair it with my galaxy note 2, it paired ok, but the typing was super laggy and inconsistent. Basically, if you want to use this with windows 8 or windows 8 tablets, then you should be good, but if you want to use this with android, you might want to look at other options.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Wedge Mobile Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is excellent for mobility. It's small enough to toss it in the laptop bag and go without taking too much space or adding extra weight. It's Bluetooth so no need for dongles or anything of that sort. The keystrokes are nice and not much noise when typing. Installing is pretty easy and straightforward. I tried on a Windows 7 machine and iPad and worked flawlessly on both.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great form factor
customer_reviews.text: One of the tech products in my EDC bag I truly consider essential. Great form factor, excellent battery life, instant seamless connection to my Android phone or tablet. Most importantly, when I type on it, I feel like I'm using an actual keyboard at normal speed instead of struggling with something shrunk down. I've convinced at least five of my friends to buy this so far, and I'll continue recommending it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Jones

customer_reviews.title: Definately worth my money!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Full sized keys Slim Portable High Quality Cons: Not rechargable I love this keyboard, its easy to use, and has really nice build quality. The keys feel nice when pressed and the wireless connectivity is really useful. The only downside to this is the lack of rechargable batteries, might want to buy a pack of AAA rechargables from Duracell or something. However, this keyboard is just awesome, thanks Microsoft!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Really nice Windows 8 Tablet keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Put in the batteries, turned it on and it connected flawlessly. I have the wedge mouse also so the software was already loaded on my tablet. I had an older Logitech keyboard that was giving me multiple key presses when I would type some letters, this fixed that issue and made me really happy. The keyboard fits in the ROO case I purchased for my Lenovo K3 very nicely. Microsoft has done a really good job with the wedge keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Joe T

customer_reviews.title: Not a full size keyboard

customer_reviews.author: Jose Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but I love it
customer_reviews.text: I pair this keyboard with my HP Stream 7. It works in every way described. It is much more rugged than I expected which is a major plus as I travel with it. The only con is that it is a fairly small layout but what do you expect with a mobile keyboard. I have recommended this to family.
customer_reviews.author: NOTaBOT

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Good travel on the keys, accurate, small enough to be portable and big enough to be useful on the go. I picked this one over the folding keyboard because it is lap-able.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: there is simply nothing bad to say about this acessory

Everything good said is true. - it's neat bu not too small - the design is great with the cover - connection is consistent and never drops - great attractive and sturdy design Microsoft out did themselves here...
customer_reviews.author: A. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Solid bluetooth keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my phone after the last BT keyboard I tried developed a nasty habit of disconnecting and reconnecting every couple of minutes. This one stays connected reliably and works well. I was impressed with the aesthetics, too; it's stylish and feels solid. I knocked off one star because the keys have a very, very short travel distance before they actuate, and their surfaces are flat, which makes touch typing feel strange - but compared to using a touchscreen keyboard it's absolutely heaven.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Perfect travel keyboard. I can set my Surface Pro 3 almost anyplace, it has a super-small footprint, without the detachable keyboard. Then I can put the tiny keyboard in my lap and work without knocking my SP3 out of my lap, which happened a couple of times before I made this acquisition.
customer_reviews.author: Redbeard

customer_reviews.title: Good BT keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Good quality Microsoft product. One of the best BT keyboards out there. Make sure you have a BT USB dongle if you do not have a built-in BT radio
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely a sublime keyboard for any tablet or computer with Bluetooth. It takes a little time to get used to. Especially if you're used to a full size keyboard. I absolutely love it and will never go back to a full size keyboard. It also comes with a nice cover for the keyboard that doubles as a stand for your tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Schirf

customer_reviews.title: Great portable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great portable keyboard. The Wedge keyboard and mouse both look very professional. The keyboard feels very sturdy and is small enough to be convenient to carry around. Of course, portability means it has smaller keys, so if you have big hands this may not be the keyboard for you. It pairs well with Android and Windows 8.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McKelvey

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Dell venue 8 pro tablet in November, and what I needed were a Bluetooth keyboard and a tablet stand. I searched in Amazon.com and found this. When I first turned it on, it was able to connect to my Dv8P automatically and the cover could be bent to a certain angle in order to support the tablet on the back comfortably. The keys are a little small, as compared to my desktop keyboard. But it feels comfortable to type with it and I can type quite fast and smoothly, without too much noise.
customer_reviews.author: B.Jann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mobile keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent price and I use it for almost four months and I love it. I use it to replace my old keyboard, which some its keys crash and didn't work at all. I hope I can use it life long if it is stone rock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard worked fine at first
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard worked fine at first. However I just went to use it again and the Duracells in it had exploded. Keyboard is useless now. You can't really take it apart to clean it out either because of the way the battery compartment is. It doesn't slide out all the way. I guess don't let it sit with batteries in it for too long.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Built Solid, Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid little keyboard with a nice hard rubber top. The top doubles as a stand for your tablet simply by folding it in half. The other nice thing about the top is you can simply throw the keyboard in a backpack and not worry about the battery draining from keypresses. Really great little device if you are looking for a bluetooth keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Puleo

product_meta.title: Microsoft Wedge Mobile Keyboard
product_meta.description:
Style:RetailThe Perfect Companion for Your Tablet. The Wedge Mobile Keyboard is the ideal balance between form and function. It has a minimalist design, yet incorporates a full-sized keyset, Windows 8 hotkeys, and cover that converts into a tablet stand so you can get more done in more places.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


MICROSOFT WEDGE MOBILE KEYBOARD
Multi-purpose cover and tablet stand A PERFECTLY PORTABLE COMPANION FOR YOUR TABLET
The new, ultra-slim Wedge Mobile Keyboard was designed for Windows 7 and Windows 8 tablet users who are constantly on the go. (It also works with iPad and most Android devices.) Its thin, lightweight design makes it easy to carry, while the full-sized, soft-touch keyset provides a comfortable, efficient typing experience that makes creating long emails and documents a breeze.

AN IDEAL BALANCE OF FORM AND FUNCTION
The Wedge Mobile Keyboard has a minimalistic yet thoughtful design that gives you exactly what you need and nothing more. The durable keyboard cover not only protects your device from scratches, but also quickly converts into a tablet stand, allowing you to work or watch movies. When you're done, simply snap the cover back on the keyboard to power it down before you stash it in your bag or backpack. It's as portable-and easy-as that.

We also built in some of the most useful commonly used features, such as Windows 8 hotkeys, to give you a quick and convenient way to search, switch between windows, and more. The keyboard also has built-in media keys, making it easy to control music and videos.

BLUETOOTH TECHNOLOGY ELIMINATES CABLE AND TRANSCEIVER
Wedge Mobile Keyboard uses Bluetooth technology, allowing you to wirelessly connect to your tablet without a cable or transceiver. For the ultimate clutter-free mobile workstation, combine the Wedge Mobile Keyboard with the Wedge Mobile Mouse.



KEY FEATURES
 1. Multi-purpose Cover - Powers down device when snapped on. Also converts into a tablet stand for an instant workstation.
    
    
 2. Windows 8 Shortcut Keys - Provides convenient access to commonly used Windows 8 functions.
    
    
 3. Media Keys - Effortlessly control your music, with next track, previous track, play, pause, and volume control keys.
    
    
 4. Windows Start Button - Simply press the Windows start button to launch the start menu.
    
    


PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Light-Touch Keys - For a more pleasant typing experience.
 * Bluetooth Wireless - Wireless Bluetooth connectivity - no transceiver required.
 * Works with Most Tablets - Provides fast, comfortable typing. Works with Windows, iPad, and most Android tablets.


SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
 * Computer/Operating System
   Windows 8, Windows RT, Windows 7. Basic functionality on ARM-based devices.
 * Hard Drive
   150 MB
 * Other
   2 AAA alkaline batteries required (included)
   Computer enabled with Bluetooth wireless technology
